result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Kendrell C Hall in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Kendrell C Hall. 
Atty Kershek requests a bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
State objects to any bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
Court denies any bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
Atty Kershek requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

filed by Atty. Mark Kershek

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:17 AM Defendant Kendrell C Hall in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Kendrell C Hall.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kendrell C Hall
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-08-2022)
Prior: 6112 N River Trail Dr, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of this action. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

2:38 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Kendrell C Hall in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Kendrell C Hall. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
